derivation.yuyuan_name: early 17th cent.: from Latin urbanus, from urbs, urb- 'city'

entry.def: Urban means belonging to, or relating to, a town or city.

example.ex: Most of the population is an urban population...
example.tran: 绝大多数人口都是城镇居民。

example.ex: Most urban areas are close to a park.
example.tran: 绝大多数城区附近都有公园。

means.word_mean: 1. relating to or concerned with a city or densely populated area;
2. located in or characteristic of a city or city life;

stems_affixes.word_buile: ex出+urban[adj.城市的, 市内的]→adj.城市远郊的

stems_affixes.value_cn: 粗野的, 粗鄙的, 无理的
stems_affixes.word_buile: in不+urbane[adj.温文尔雅的,懂礼的]→adj.粗野的, 粗鄙的, 无理的
urb城市+an表示地方→adj.城市的, 市内的
urb城市+ane→有城市人的分度
urbane[adj.温文尔雅的,懂礼的]+ity表名词→n.有礼貌, 文雅
sub下面+urb城市→在城市下面→郊区
suburb[n.市郊,郊区]+an+ite人→n.郊区居民

stems_affixes.type_exp: 1. 表名词和形容词,"……地方,……人或动物等"; 2. ……的

stems_affixes.word_buile: Americ美国,美洲+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.美洲的 n.美国人
republic共和国+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.共和的
Rom+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.古罗马人 adj.罗马的
ruffi=brutal残忍的,兽性的+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.恶棍,歹徒 adj.残暴的
sub下面+urban城市的→城市下面→城市之外的→郊区的
urb城市+an表示地方→adj.城市的,市内的
veter+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.老兵,老手;老兵的; adj.经验丰富的
Americ美国,美洲+an……地方,……人或动物等→adj.美洲的 n.美国人
amphi两个,两种+bi生命+an……地方,……人或动物等→两个生命→两栖动物
arti技巧+s+an人→技巧之人→工匠
parti=party党,一部分人+s+an人→党人→党徒
Rom+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.古罗马人 adj.罗马的
ruffi=brutal残忍的,兽性的+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.恶棍,歹徒 adj.残暴的
Spart斯巴达+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.斯巴达人
veter+an……地方,……人或动物等→n.老兵,老手;老兵的; adj.经验丰富的

Sentence.sentence: SAT scores began dropping in 1963;today,on average,30% of students do not complete high school in four years, a figure that rises to 50% in poor urban neighborhoods.

And most noticeable of all, there is the phenomenon of large urban and suburban high schools that have split up into smaller units of a few hundred, generally housed in the same grounds that once boasted thousands of students all marching to the same band.
A great variety of schools have sprung up in urban and suburban areas.
This nameless person pushed the human race over a historic threshold, for it was in that year that mankind became, for the first time in its history, a predominantly urban species.
Those factors are more than enough to make up for the squalor (肮脏), disease and spectacular poverty that those same migrants must often at first endure when they become urban dwellers

His main thesis is that the buzz of urban life, and the opportunities it offers for co-operation and collaboration, is what attracts people to the city, which in turn makes cities into the engines of art, commerce, science and progress.

sentences.en: Traffic is a major urban problem.
sentences.cn: 交通是城市的一个主要问题。

Traffic is a major urban problem.
